``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {#7677fe45 .cell execution_count=55} ``` {.python .cell-code} from scipy import integrate ``` ::: ::: {#dbfc5ab7 .cell execution_count=56} ``` {.python .cell-code} def linear_multistep_coeff(order, t, i, j): if order-1 > i: raise ValueError(f'Order {order} too high for step {i}') def fn(tau): prod = 1. for k in range(order): if j == k: continue prod *= (tau-t[i-k]) / (t[i-j]-t[i-k]) return prod return integrate.quad(fn, t[i], t[i+1], epsrel=1e-4)[0] ``` ::: ::: {#18bcea1a .cell execution_count=57} ``` {.python .cell-code} @torch.no_grad() def sample_lms(model, steps=100, order=4, sigma_max=80.): preds = [] x = torch.randn(sz).to(model.device)*sigma_max sigs = sigmas_karras(steps, device=model.device, sigma_max=sigma_max) ds = [] for i in progress_bar(range(len(sigs)-1)): sig = sigs[i] denoised = denoise(model, x, sig) d = (x-denoised)/sig ds.append(d) if len(ds) > order: ds.pop(0) cur_order = min(i+1, order) coeffs = [linear_multistep_coeff(cur_order, sigs, i, j) for j in range(cur_order)] x = x + sum(coeff*d for coeff, d in zip(coeffs, reversed(ds))) preds.append(x) return preds ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}
